author: TravisEz13
body:
Specifically, It failed on this line:
https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/build.psm1#L851
in this build
https://travis-ci.org/probonopd/PowerShell/builds/154307593
Then after the clone depth was increased it worked in this build:
https://travis-ci.org/probonopd/PowerShell/builds/154313098

The root cause error was:
`fatal: No names found, cannot describe anything.`

All the errors seen in the build were:

```
fatal: No names found, cannot describe anything.
WARNING: Please ensure you have previously run Start-PSBuild -Clean -CrossGen!
WARNING: -Types was not specified, continuing with deb!
New-UnixPackage : Cannot bind argument to parameter 'Version' because it is an 
empty string.
At /home/travis/build/probonopd/PowerShell/build.psm1:909 char:29
+             New-UnixPackage @Arguments
+                             ~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : InvalidData: (:) [New-UnixPackage], ParameterBin 
   dingValidationException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : ParameterArgumentValidationErrorEmptyStringNotAl 
   lowed,New-UnixPackage

Test-Path : Cannot bind argument to parameter 'LiteralPath' because it is an 
empty string.
At /home/travis/build/probonopd/PowerShell/src/powershell-unix/bin/Linux/netcor
eapp1.0/ubuntu.14.04-x64/publish/Modules/Pester/Pester.psm1:283 char:41
+                 (Test-Path -LiteralPath $unresolvedPath -PathType Lea ...
+                                         ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : InvalidData: (:) [Test-Path], ParameterBindingVa 
   lidationException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : ParameterArgumentValidationErrorEmptyStringNotAl 
   lowed,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.TestPathCommand
```
title: Build.psm1 should not get the tag names from history as it prevent a shallow clone
